TopicTitle: Looking for mods adding more antennas supported by remote tech

Articles.Content:
Hello kerbonaut

i fell in love with the mod called Remote Tech, adding a pretty funny mechanic into the core game.

however i really feel the antennas and satelite dishes the mod offers are pretty boring (no offence to the modder(s) of Remote Tech), and was wondering if there was a pack of Remote Tech supported Antennas out there, adding more omni directional and target antennas, looking more awesome?

i've been trying to search for some, but have been unable to find any at all, i really hope someone are able to help me out

AES did, but I don't know how well it's supported in 0.25.

BoxSat and FASA also have some antenna parts that should work with RT.

As jordanjay29 said thats about it there a couple here and there but not bunch Aies can be found here and they work fine in .25 http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/35383-0-21-1-AIES-Aerospace-v1-4-2

here is a RT cfg for Aies https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/72893034/RemoteTech_AIES_3.cfg

And here is BoxSat http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92563-KSP-BoxSat-A-02-Release-Candidate-Streaming-on-Twitch-Tonight!?viewfull=1 Great little Sat Mod

LLL as some http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24906-WIP-LLL-Lack-Luster-Labs-Latest-version-0-10-6-for-KSP-0-22-x

And if you like prebuilt http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/12106-0-23-5-Lionhead-Aerospace-Inc-Probes-and-Landers-Pack-updated

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93389-0-25-US-Probes-Pack-Old-and-New-v0-26-Release-10-19-14 and http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/88045

thanks guys, sorry for no reply... i am not very use to this type of forums, so i kinda lost the thread, after i posted it, so it randomly appeared today, as i was logging in

i've kinda played arround with ksp scripting, and figured out a way to add the variables to make them supported by remote tech, so i've been busy adding remotetech support for my favorite antennas

however thanks for the links, been looking trough them, for more antennas to play with

I don't know if you are still interested in having more antennas. If you are, you can check out my RT expansion which adds 4 new antennas

(link is in my sig)

this set of antennas will let you make a communications network around the joolian system. You will be able to connect with the outer moons without using interplanetary antennas (which seems silly)

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited March 11, 2015 by Sigma88

Sigma88, you beat me to suggesting those antennas! lol

Anyway, I think that the Outer Planets mod suggests a set of antennas for the increased range!

It sure would be nice if all the mod part authors included configurations to make their antennas work with RemoteTech and the simpler AntennaRange gameplay mods.

It might be easier for someone that has the time and skill to do a survey of all extant mod antennas and write a ModuleManager script to adapt them to either gameplay mod. There are a lot of antennas out there, and only a few are RT or AR ready as they are.

Sigma88, you beat me to suggesting those antennas! lol

Anyway, I think that the Outer Planets mod suggests a set of antennas for the increased range!

opm changes one RT antenna range to make it reach plock, I've actually removed that config in my save and downloaded the origami antenna

But I still needed a set of antennas for the jool system. the 3 new I made should be fine with all the others moons/planets in OPM.

I've just sent a set of 8 satellites to jool: 2 hubs to orbit jool each with the five antennas in my picture and a big interplanetary antenna to reach home.

and then 6 minor satellites with 1 antenna each and scansat scanners (to put around jool and the five moons)

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98205-0-25-ORIGAMI-foldable-antenna-dishes-for-RemoteTech

One of those is huge, the antenna with the blue lights in this.

The other one is a foldable one which won't fall apart in the atmosphere ( if it's folded ), iirc. Both should be handy for OPM, assuming they still work - no reason they shouldn't tbh. I dropped RT for 0.90 so I didn't test.
